Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the significance of the Newsweek-branded "Madam President" publication cover by declaring that it declared Hillary Clinton the winner of the presidential election prior to 8 November 2016, when in fact it was a mock-up image for a potential post-election publication.
Understate: There is no evidence of understatement bias in the claim.
Falters at times: The claim does not falter at times.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it presents a misleading interpretation of the Newsweek cover.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the existence of the Newsweek cover is evidence of media collusion with the Clinton campaign to rig the election, which is a problematic assumption.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider alternative explanations for the existence of the Newsweek cover, such as it being a standard practice in the souvenir business to prepare commemorative items anticipating major events.
